Debug Player
  • Getting Started
  • View page source

Getting Started

This guide will help you get up and running with Debug Player.

Installation

First, install Debug Player using pip:

pip install debug-player

Or install from source:

git clone https://github.com/imagry/debug-player.git
cd debug-player
pip install -e .

Basic Usage

  1. Launch the application:

    debug-player

  2. Load a data file: - Click “File” > “Open” or press Ctrl+O - Navigate to your data file and select it

  3. Navigate the interface: - Use the timeline at the bottom to navigate through the data - Zoom in/out using the mouse wheel or +/- buttons - Pan by clicking and dragging

  4. View signals: - Signals are displayed in the left sidebar - Click on a signal to view its plot - Right-click on a plot for more options

  5. Save your session: - Click “File” > “Save Session” to save your current layout and settings

Key Features

Signal Visualization

  • Plot multiple signals on the same axis

  • Customize line styles, colors, and markers

  • Add annotations and markers to important points

Data Analysis

  • Calculate statistics for selected time ranges

  • Export data to CSV or other formats

  • Apply filters and transformations to signals

Plugin System

Debug Player supports plugins to extend its functionality. To load a plugin:

  1. Click “Plugins” > “Load Plugin”

  2. Navigate to the plugin file (.py)

  3. The plugin will appear in the Plugins menu

Keyboard Shortcuts

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  1. Missing Dependencies - Make sure all required dependencies are installed - Run pip install -r requirements.txt

  2. Plugin Loading Issues - Check the console for error messages - Make sure the plugin implements the required interface

  3. Performance Issues - Try reducing the number of visible signals - Increase the data decimation factor in settings

Getting Help

  • Check the User Guide for more detailed information

  • Visit our GitHub repository

  • Open an issue on GitHub for bug reports and feature requests
